Tanks

Class Tank

  • java.lang.Object
    • Tanks.Tank
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Tank>

    public class Tank
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Tank>
    The Tank class represents a tank object in a game environment. Tanks have attributes such as position, velocity, health, fuel, power, and score, and can perform actions like movement, shooting, and airstrikes.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Tank

        public Tank(int x,
            int y,
            int[] terrain_new,
            java.lang.String color,
            java.util.ArrayList<Tank> tanks,
            int tankID,
            int wind,
            char name)
        Constructs a new Tank object with the specified parameters.
        Parameters:
        x - The initial X-coordinate of the tank.
        y - The initial Y-coordinate of the tank.
        terrain_new - The terrain information.
        color - The color of the tank.
        tanks - The list of all tanks in the game.
        tankID - The unique ID of the tank.
        wind - The wind speed.
        name - The name of the tank.

    • Method Detail

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Tank t)
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Tank>

      • tick

        public void tick(processing.core.PApplet app)
        Updates the state of the tank for each game tick.
        Parameters:
        app - The PApplet instance.

      • explode

        public void explode()
        Initiates an explosion by creating a bullet at the tank's position. The explosion occurs when the tank's y-coordinate exceeds a certain threshold, typically indicating that the tank has fallen off the terrain. The bullet created represents the explosion effect.

      • draw

        public void draw(processing.core.PApplet app)
        Draws the tank on the screen.
        Parameters:
        app - The PApplet instance.

      • moveRight

        public void moveRight()
        Moves the tank to the right if fuel is available. If fuel is depleted, the tank stops moving.

      • moveLeft

        public void moveLeft()
        Moves the tank to the left if fuel is available. If fuel is depleted, the tank stops moving.

      • moveTurret

        public void moveTurret(java.lang.String direction)
        Rotates the turret of the tank either left or right.
        Parameters:
        direction - The direction to rotate the turret ("right" or "left").

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the horizontal movement of the tank. The tank remains stationary until further movement commands are issued.

      • stopTurret

        public void stopTurret()
        Stops the rotation of the turret. The turret remains in its current position until further rotation commands are issued.

      • shoot

        public void shoot()
        Initiates a shooting action by creating a new bullet at the tank's turret position. The bullet inherits the tank's position, angle, and other properties.

      • airStrikePowerUp

        public void airStrikePowerUp(int x)
        Initiates an airstrike power-up by creating a bullet at the specified x-coordinate. The airstrike bullet travels vertically downwards, causing damage upon impact.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate at which to initiate the airstrike.

      • updateBullets

        public void updateBullets(processing.core.PApplet app)
        Updates the positions and states of bullets fired by the tank. Removes bullets that have gone off-screen.
        Parameters:
        app - The PApplet instance.

      • displayBullets

        public void displayBullets(processing.core.PApplet app)
        Renders all bullets fired by the tank on the screen.
        Parameters:
        app - The PApplet instance.

      • setTerrain

        public void setTerrain(int[] terrain)

      • increasePower

        public void increasePower()
        Increases the power of the tank's shots. Power is capped at the tank's health level.

      • decreasePower

        public void decreasePower()
        Decreases the power of the tank's shots. Power cannot go below zero.

      • resetValues

        public void resetValues()
        Resets the tank's attributes to their default values. Used when respawning the tank or starting a new game.

      • incrementParachute

        public void incrementParachute()

        public char getName()
